result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony D. Robinson

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on November 15, 2022 at 09:50 am.

Includes 19CM1331 and 22CM860
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence; Attorney Roley appears in person; Defendant appears in person
DATES: 
PLEA 11/15/22 at 9:50 am
Pre-trial conference on October 12, 2022 at 02:20 pm.

10:38 AM 
Clerk Micki.
INCLUDES 19CM1331, 21CM1081, and 22CM860.

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person, with Attorney Thomas Roley.

Date and time set for a JPTC. VRCW.

Atty Roley makes statement. Defendant has picked up a new case.
DDA Lawrence makes statement. Will extend a global offer with the new file.
COURT recites PTC date and time.

NEXT DATES >>
PTC w/JA - 10/12/22 at 2:20 p.m. (Defendant must personally appear)

ADJ: 10:41 a.m.

No contact with victim(s): J.D.D. or J.J. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence; Wausau P.D.  No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk:  Amy. 
Called:  2:10 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Cannon and Atty Natasha VanLieshout.  

Date and time set for initial appearance; VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
PLEA: Not guilty.  

ADA Mayo makes request to Court re: redaction of victim name in criminal complaint; Court makes findings and grants redaction.

BOND:  $500.00 signature bond.  

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): J.D.D. or J.J.  
- Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence; Wausau PD. 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

JPTC:  9/13/22 at 10:30 a.m. 

Adj:  2:12 p.m. 

Branch 6.

(mins amended 3:29 p.m.- ajr)
